result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew John Johnson

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
2:15 PM Defendant Matthew John Johnson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Court questions DE on PD appt.  DE states he was denied.  Court questions why DE didn't qualify for PD appt.  Court finds DE conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Peter Masana (608) 448-4109.  To reimburse the Clerk of Courts Office $50/month beginning on or before 10/1/22 and then by the first of each month thereafter.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Absolute Sobriety of alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid Rx

2:59 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew John Johnson appeared by video, in custody from LEC w/atty. Getsinger. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE does not qualify for PD representation. State requests $5000 Cash with conditions.  Atty. Getsinger argues for signature bond. Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $2500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety of alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid Rx.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on September 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
